caption: The photograph showcases two informational signs suspended by chains in what appears to be an indoor setting. The primary sign is a large arrow pointing to the right and is labeled "Pulmonary Lab" in bold, black letters on a white background. Above this main arrow sign, there is a smaller hanging sign that reads "Black Lung Studies" in black text on a white background, suggesting the direction to a specific area or focus within the Pulmonary Lab dedicated to studying black lung disease. The background of the photograph is dark, enhancing the visibility and readability of the signs. This setting suggests a medical or research facility where pulmonary issues, including black lung disease, are studied and treated.
title: Sign to laboratory where black lung studies are underway with supervision by dr.  Donald rasmussen.  Miners from the area of the Appalachian regional hospital at Beckley, West Virginia, and several other states arrive to learn if they have an accumulation of coal dust particles filling up their lungs which leads to a progressive shortness of breath
